description: Define domain extraction + normalization approach for inbound sender emails (use normalized sender email and extract substring after '@')
Implement domain-to-client lookup derived from existing contacts (unique client only; ignore inactive contacts)
Define client default contact storage using existing client properties field `clients.properties.primary_contact_id` (+ optional `primary_contact_name`)
Resolve default contact ID safely (exists, belongs to client, active) when applying domain fallback
Inbound email (new ticket path): if no exact contact match, attempt domain match to set target client; apply default contact if configured
Inbound email: preserve precedence (exact contact match overrides domain match; domain match overrides defaults client)
Inbound email: if resolved target client differs from inbound defaults client, do not apply defaults.location_id (avoid cross-client location mismatch)
Workflow action parity: update `resolve_inbound_ticket_context` to include the same domain fallback + default contact behavior
Client UI: add a 'Default contact' picker on the client screen and persist to `client.properties.primary_contact_id`
Client UI: allow clearing the default contact (removes/empties `primary_contact_id` and `primary_contact_name` in client properties)
Add automated coverage for domain fallback matching in inbound email processing (integration tests)
Add automated coverage for client default contact UI persistence (unit/integration test)
